dt.t: He {wi}flirts{/wi} with every attractive woman he meets.

dt: {bc}to show superficial or casual interest or liking
{bc}to come close to reaching or experiencing something

dt.t: They {wi}flirt{/wi} water at each other's faces.

pt: {sc}trifle{/sc} {sc}toy{/sc} {sc}dally{/sc} {sc}flirt{/sc} {sc}coquet{/sc} mean to deal with or act toward without serious purpose. {sc}trifle{/sc} may imply playfulness, unconcern, indulgent contempt.
{sc}toy{/sc} implies acting without full attention or serious exertion of one's powers.

pt.t: a political novice {it}toying{/it} with great issues

pt: {sc}dally{/sc} suggests indulging in thoughts or plans merely as an amusement.

pt.t: {it}dallying{/it} with the idea of building a boat someday

pt: {sc}flirt{/sc} implies an interest or attention that soon passes to another object.

pt.t: {it}flirted{/it} with one fashionable ism after another

pt: {sc}coquet{/sc} implies attracting interest or admiration without serious intention.

pt.t: companies that {it}coquet{/it} with environmentalism solely for public relations

shortdef: to behave amorously without serious intent
to show superficial or casual interest or liking; also : experiment
an act or instance of flirting
